intro: Embothrium rubricaule, commonly known as the red-hair tree, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree or shrub, typically growing up to 10 meters in height. The plant is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers that appear in clusters, adding a vibrant color to its foliage. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a leathery texture. Embothrium rubricaule thrives in temperate climates and is often found in forested areas, where it plays a role in supporting local biodiversity.
